lead_paragraph: His voice quivering, the prime minister responded to biting criticism of his decision to ban large notes in circulation in an effort to fight corruption.

byline.contributor: Geeta Anand reported from Mumbai, and Hari Kumar from New Delhi. Ellen Barry contributed reporting from New Delhi.
byline.original: By GEETA ANAND and HARI KUMAR

headline.print_headline: India’s Leader Delivers Emotional Defense of Currency Move
headline.main: Narendra Modi Defends Currency Move as Millions in India Scramble for Cash

snippet: His voice quivering, the prime minister responded to biting criticism of his decision to ban large notes in circulation in an effort to fight corruption....
abstract: Indian Prime Min Narendra Modi responds defensively to criticisms of his surprise ban on existing 500-rupee and 1,000-rupee notes in circulation, claiming move will address existing corruption; residents express mixed reaction to initiative as many struggle to obtain new currency notes in order to purchase basic necessities.
